detaileddescription.para:
You can define root domain if for some reason you have problems with Javascript and/or CSS Cache Files Paths. If you have no problems you can leave it empty.
string $domain

Cache directory root path. If you do not change orginal TIDEngine structure, Default : 'cache/' If you have your own structure set path depending of your needs.
string $root_cache

Cached Templates/Pages cache directory name. Default : 'pages/'
string $pages_cache

Css cache directory name. Default : 'css/'
string $css_cache

Javascript cache directory name. Default : 'javascript/'
string $js_cache

Javascript source files directory path. Default : 'javascript/native/source/'
string $javascript_source

Javascript minified files directory path. Default : 'javascript/native/minified/'
string $javascript_minified

Javascript Frameworks source files directory path. Default : 'javascript/frameworks/'
string $frameworks_source

CSS source files directory path. Default : 'css/'
string $css_source
Templates/Pages cache files unique naming type.

parameterdescription.para:
- you can use one of the following name possibilities:
md5 - Page/Template cache name is md5 value of template name.
sha1 - Page/Template cache name is sha1 value of template name.
native - use native templatre names

detaileddescription.para: Cache name prefix implemented for easier data changes check unique value inside brackets.
Cache name sufix implemented for easier data changes check unique value inside brackets.
Pages cache extension in use, you can use any type of extension, because Template/Page Cache File just store XHTML code, there are no direct access, they are final data storag, render by TIDEngine.

Use Server Caching. If this is enabled all Page Components will be processed depending of Settings and Cached on Server Side. Until Page Components do not expire or some of Data are changed TIDEngine will serve Cached. Files for every Page Request.

Use Client/Browser Caching. If this is enabled on every page request will be checked Cache existance and validity.
If Cache files pass checking for individual Cache file will be set 304 Redirect - Not Modified.
EG. If you have unique Javascript files for all pages on different pages access will be used same Javascript, CSS files from Browser cache if is valid if not TIDEngine will serve Server Side Cached Files.
Use gzip compression on Page/Template Compress Server Side Cache Files.

Set general compression level for all Cache Files. There are 1-9 - gzip compression levels.
fast: 1-4,
slower: 5-6 (but better compression),
slow: 7-9 (up to 2x faster, best compression) On files under 300K level 4 is good enought.
You can use two types of XHTML Optimization. Indent XHTML code or clean whitespace and combine XHTML code in one lien.

listitem.para: compact - optimize XHTML code and remove whitespace complete XHTML in one line
false - any value no XHTML manipulation

detaileddescription.para: Set default indentation space only. EG. ' '

Use CSS optimization. Clean CSS files and put all code in one line - size reduction.
Todo
add CSStidy support
Use gzip compression on CSS Cache files. File size reduction.
Combine all CSS files in one unique file. CoReduces the number of HTTP requests.
Set file name for combined file. If we combine all CSS files combined CSS file name.

listitem.para: CSS Files versioning if we need it.

detaileddescription.para: Set default CSS extension. Look sily but we need that for Safari gzip bug. Safari acceprt default extension for gzipped files in format .css.gz or .css.gz.css*
Use Javascript optimization. Clean Javascript files and put all code in one line - size reduction. This means we will use some of external Javascript Packers.

Combine all Javascript and Javscript Frameworks files in one file. If we use this option all Javascript files will be treated as native Javascript files. Compress Javascript files - Reduces the number of HTTP requests.

Combine all Javascript files in two files, one for native Javascript source files and other for Javscript Frameworks Files. Compress Javascript files - Reduces the number of HTTP requests.
If $combine_all_javascript are enabled this setting will have no effects.
Use gzip compression on Javascript Cache files . Compress Javascript files - size reduction.

Optimize Javascript files, by using some of build in Javascript Packers. You must realize that every time you use Javascript Optimization you will have high server load, and long response time.
Workarround for this is to create minified versions of Javascript Frameworks files. Or to create them on Localhost.
By default TIDEngine checks if there are minified version of Javascript files during first time load and if they do not exist create them, so you will have high Server load just once during creation of minified version of Javascript files. When you have minified version of Javascript files there are no high Server load. If you do not have Javascript changes you could just:
set $cache_lifetime = 'permanent'; and
change .httacces file lines 1 month to 1 year:
ExpiresByTypeapplication/javascript"accessplus1month" ExpiresByTypeapplication/x-javascript"accessplus1month"

listitem.para: packer - PHP 5 ported version of Dean Edwards Packer
jsmin - JSmin packer PHP ported version of Dean Edwards JSmin
jshrink - JShrink-0.2.class.php hosted on Google Code
jsminplus - one more port of Dean Edwards JSmin
native - TIDEngine native compressor based on regular Expressions - Not finished.

detaileddescription.para: Set default Javascript extension. Look sily but we need that for Safari gzip bug. Safari acceprt default extension for gzipped files in format .js.gz.js or .css.gz.css*
New combined javascript file name. When we use combinig all Javascript files into one.
New combined javascript file name. When we combine native Javascript files ad one Cache file and Frameworks as second..
New combined frameworks file name. When we combine native Javascript files ad one Cache file and Frameworks as second..
If Framework type in use.

listitem.para: source - If we use source - no minified versions of Javascript will be created.
minified - If we use minified - minified versions of all Javascript will be created.

Code taken php.org and slitly adapted. Lightweight alternative for Browscap.

- string to check if we have access by defined agent
Get Client Browser headers data.
Calculate Cache Life Time in miliseconds

Workarround for Safari problem with gzipped content we need other type of compressed cache files extensions. As some hosting companies do not support get_browser function I was thinking that best solution is native Browscap class - first time load this class will update all data in cache file. eg. Other browsers .css.gz and .js.gz Safari css.gz.css and js.gz.js
infact this is not strict rule you can set any kind of extension just not to be .gz eg. js.gz.xyz and css.gz.xyz - this will work without problem.
Uncomment this line :
$check_browser = new Browscap($this->Browscap_cache); $browser = $check_browser->getBrowser(null, false); $this->browser = $browser->Browser;
and
$this->Browscap_cache = $this->root_cache . 'Browscap';
also comment this two lines of code:
$browser = $this->browser_info(); $this->browser = ucfirst($browser[0]);

TIDEngine core class
bogyvet
